title: Troubleshooting Valve Issues Using A Voltmeter

tasks.task: Troubleshooting a malfunctioning sprinkler zone using a voltmeter.
subtasks: Ensure you have a multimeter (voltmeter) for troubleshooting electrical components.
Determine the type of issue (zone won't stop running, one zone isn't coming on, or one zone won't come on at all).
Check if the controller is working properly by measuring voltage between common terminal and zone terminal.
Test solenoid resistance using multimeter's resistance range.
Verify wire connections at the valve box and check for broken wires, corrosion, or improper connections.
Replace a faulty solenoid or valve if necessary.
Check for wiring issues, such as disconnected, corroded, or incorrectly connected wires, and replace if needed.
Consider upgrading to a smart controller for future projects.

tasks.task: Upgrading a basic sprinkler controller to a smart controller.
subtasks: Research smart controller options on sprinklerwarehouse.com.
Consider the benefits of a smart controller, such as smartphone control and programmability.
